briefdescription.para: Amount of time used when looking for the traces.

detaileddescription.para: This amount is in miliseconds and the default is 1000.

briefdescription.para: TraceView used to actually display the traces.
Starting time when looking for the traces.

detaileddescription.para: This amount is in miliseconds and the default is 0.

briefdescription.para: Spine box enabling to choose the start time in minutes used to display the traces.
Spine box enabling to choose the start time in seconds used to display the traces.
Spine box enabling to choose the start time in miliseconds used to display the traces.
Small box where the user can enter the width of the time frame to use to display the traces.
Boolean used to prevent the trigger of changes during initialization.
Length of the recording in miliseconds.
ScrollBar line step size in miliseconds.
ScrollBar page step size in miliseconds.
Container for the selection widget.
When converting the recording length in minutes, seconds and miliseconds this represents the number of minutes.
When converting the recording length in minutes, seconds and miliseconds this represents the number of seconds.
When converting the recording length in minutes, seconds and miliseconds this represents the number of miliseconds.
True if the TraceView has to be updated, false otherwise.

memberdef.name: TraceWidget

parameterdescription.para: starting time in miliseconds.
time window in miliseconds.
true if all the channels are display either in a gradation of grey false if they are display in color.
a reference on the provider of the channels data.
true if the traces are displayed on multiple columns, false otherwise.
true if vertical lines are displayed to show the clusters, false otherwise.
true if a raster is drawn to show the clusters, false otherwise
true if waveforms are drawn on top of the traces, false otherwise.
true if labels are drawn next to the traces, false otherwise.
a reference on the list of channel to be shown at the opening of the view.
initial gain use to draw the traces in the TraceView.
acquisition gain.
a pointer on the list of colors for the channels.
a pointer on the map given the list of channels for each group.
a pointer on the map given to which group each channel belongs.
a reference on the list containing the offset for each channel.
a reference on the list of the exponents used to compute the drawing gain for each channel.
list of skipped channels.
the parent QWidget.
name of the widget (can be used for introspection).
color used as background.
a reference to the application status bar.
minumum size of the view.
maximum size of the view.
the top-left corner of the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
bottom-right corner of the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
size of the border between the frame and the contents.

briefdescription.para: Returns the time amount, in milisecond, of the time frame used by the TraceView.
Returns the start time of the time frame used by the TraceView.
Installs the event filter on the view contained in the widget.
All the channels are now display either in a gradation of grey or in color.

parameterdescription.para: true if the channels have to be displayed in grey false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Display the traces starting at the given time in miliseconds.

detaileddescription.para:
The selection widgets are updated accordingly.
time
starting time to display the traces.

briefdescription.para: Sets the mode of presentation to single or multiple columns.

parameterdescription.para: true if the traces are presented on multiple columns, false if they are presented on a single column.

briefdescription.para: Displays or hides vertical lines to show the clusters.

parameterdescription.para: true if the vertical lines are drawn for each cluster, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Displays or hides a raster to show the clusters.

parameterdescription.para: true if a raster is drawn, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Displays or hides the cluster waveforms on top of the traces.

parameterdescription.para: true if the waveforms are drawn, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Informs listener that the channels selectedIds have been selected.

parameterdescription.para: list of channels selected by the user in a view.

briefdescription.para: Change the current mode, call by a selection of a tool.

parameterdescription.para: new mode of drawing.
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

new list of clusters to be shown.

new list of events to be shown.

Triggers the decrease of the amplitude of all the channels.

briefdescription.para: Triggers the decrease of the amplitude of the selected channels.

briefdescription.para: Displays the traces starting at the given time time in miliseconds and for the given duration duration.

The selection widgets are updated accordingly.

duration

briefdescription.para: Shows or hides the calibration bar.

detaileddescription.para:
This bar is meaningful only when all the channels have the same amplification.
show
true if the bar has to be shown false otherwise.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Updates the different time selection widgets due to a modification of the sampling rate for the document.

Informs the view to update the traces.
length
